title: We'll be able to hit zombies with meat in singleplayer medieval survival sim God Save Birmingham
partialText: The King can look after himself.

title: The best Smash Bros.-like on Steam just added a character who can shop for items and go fishing in the middle of a match, in case you thought fighting games were too one-note
partialText: Fin-ish him.

title: Five new Steam games you probably missed (February 16, 2026)
partialText: Sorting through every new game on Steam so you don't have to.

title: Solid Snake is coming to Rainbow Six Siege in March with David Hayter reprising the role, and a new trailer shows Snake and stealth game rival Sam Fisher finally squashing the beef
partialText: New playlists, weapons, map updates, and yes, Solid Snake, await.

title: Hideki Sato, father of the Sega Dreamcast, Saturn, Genesis, and more, has died
partialText: Sato's career in games began in the 1970s.

title: Silent Hill 2 Remake dev Bloober Team's Valentine's Day reveal turned out to be Layers of Fear 3
partialText: Sorry if you were expecting Cronos 2.

title: The EU declares TikTok's 'infinite scroll' and 'highly personalised recommender system' are 'addictive design in breach of the Digital Services Act'
partialText: The European Commission has taken a stance against some of social media's deleterious rhythms.

title: Doom co-creator John Romero adores Ghost Recon and has over 3,000 hours in World of Warcraft: 'God, I lived in that game every day for five years'
partialText: The co-founder of id Software and Romero Games takes us on a tour of his games library.

title: The most surprising thing about Mewgenics is its amazing soundtrack—and after 115 hours, I'm still discovering new songs
partialText: I'm a chumbucket kitty baby living in the city.

title: Someone is building a lifesized Seikret cosplay despite the fact they've 'never made anything like this before' and after seeing the process, you can't convince me this thing doesn't live and breathe
partialText: His name is Zekki, and I love him.

title: Absolum's first update dares you to unravel the threads of fate, introducing rule modifiers, corrupted biomes and improved mounts into 2025's best beat 'em up
partialText: Play new game presets or create your own in Guard Crush Games' stunning slugfest.

title: Hellscreen, the FPS with a rear-view mirror, has left Steam early access two episodes short of its original plan: 'This is a bittersweet experience for me'
partialText: The Doom-like shooter was unable to realise its final form due to "budget reasons."

title: Seafaring survival sim The Last Caretaker gets a big update that adds a speedy jet ski and lets you customise your base-boat
partialText: Also adds new quests, locations and a sonar module.

title: Unreal Tournament 2004 is now available for free thanks to its fan community, and they've even updated the game for modern PCs: 'This is the first public patch for Unreal Tournament 2004 in over 20 years'
partialText: Wicked sick.

title: As the Legacy of Kain remasters continue, a new game emerges—a 2D action-platformer
partialText: Legacy of Kain: Ascendance and Legacy of Kain: Defiance Remastered will both be available in March.

title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 easter eggs hinting Baldur's Gate 3 would be Larian's next game had to be toned down: 'Originally the reference to BG3 was very explicit'
partialText: Does this mean there are hints in Baldur's Gate 3 about what'll be in Divinity?

title: 'We lost things such as physics in games:' The dev behind my most anticipated RPG thinks players are craving more interactive games, not just 'moving around in a static 3D environment'
partialText: Well, I am, anyway.

title: 'They can never kill emulation': Players vexed as Nintendo continues its siege on Switch emulation, handing DMCAs to various emulators on GitHub
partialText: It might be time to back up some files.

title: The dev behind my top upcoming RPG is a Hungarian chef who thought 'if not now, then when?' and learned coding from scratch to make his dream 'eurojank' masterpiece
partialText: "People have been craving this sort of experience, which was offered by Larian and CD Projekt."

title: That new Metal Gear Solid collection won't include Metal Gear Online, but it will have Peace Walker's essential online co-op
partialText: Konami giveth, and Konami taketh away.

title: Mewgenics provides the best proof yet that the turn-based tactics genre is the true home of drama and excitement in gaming
partialText: Treat me mean, keep me keen.

title: Inside PC gaming's wildly creative Tomb Raider mapping scene: 'Being able to create my own adventures for other people to play is such an addicting concept'
partialText: Tomb Raider has a fan-level scene as storied as Quake or Thief.

title: The Overwatch dating sim and its associated rewards are back for a limited time, but it's still got far fewer romances than its China-exclusive counterpart
partialText: Sorry if you were hoping to woo Junker Queen or Mauga.

title: Question time: What role—tank, healer, or DPS—do you actually play in MMORPGS, and why?
partialText: Party finder.

title: Can you guess which videogame these potions are from?
partialText: A cure for all that ails.

title: Digging a little deeper into Intel's Xe3 architecture shows exactly why Panther Lake's iGPU is good: It's basically an Arc A770 graphics card jammed into a mobile chip
partialText: And with better DRAM, it would absolutely fly.

title: Underrated hack 'n' slash Blades of Fire heads to Steam with a 2.0 update, bringing new game plus and 'expanded death and mutilation variations' for you sickos out there
partialText: It's me. I'm the sicko.

title: THQ's Gothic 1 remake arrives in June, and I think it might prove a more valuable overhaul than Oblivion Remastered
partialText: The great grandaddy of eurojank looks spiffing in its latest trailer.

title: Which PC gaming icon is your soulmate this Valentine's Day?
partialText: Love is in the air.

title: Bloodlines 2's Valentine's patch adds further customisation options and lootable blood bags, because nothing says 'I love you' like the vampire equivalent of a ready meal
partialText: Love bite.

title: Final Fantasy 14's Valentine's Day event is a Mario Party-lite encounter that reminded me it's actually quite fun to do some socializing in an MMO
partialText: I am become Cake Boss.

title: This horror sim is like running a food truck in Fallout: cook questionable meals for mutants, monsters, and the occasional alien
partialText: There are a lot of hungry mouths to feed in the wasteland. Some of them are even on faces.

title: High on Life 2 review
partialText: A creative, funny, and surprisingly chill adventure with nagging problems.

title: Oh, good: Discord's age verification rollout has ties to Palantir co-founder and panopticon architect Peter Thiel
partialText: Discord is "experimenting" with an age authentication vendor whose major investors include Thiel's Founders Fund.

title: Microsoft AI CEO curiously omits 'Microsoft AI CEO'  from list of white collar jobs that will be replaceable by AI in next 18 months
partialText: I'm sure there's a good reason for the omission.

title: Three years after its last update, the original Kingdom Come: Deliverance gets a new patch that includes a new caparison for your horse
partialText: Don't worry if you don't know what a caparison is: I looked it up so you don't have to.

title: Sandfall Interactive continues its Larian-like ways as Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 wins Game of the Year and four other trophies at the DICE Awards
partialText: Other big winners at this year's event include Ghost of Yotei, Death Stranding 2, and Blue Prince.

title: Tumbler Ridge mass murderer once created a mass shooting game in Roblox
partialText: Roblox says it has terminated the account belonging to Tumbler Ridge shooter Jesse Van Rootselaar, and deleted the game.

title: Brace for more Belmont: Konami says Castlevania: Belmont's Curse is just 'the beginning of numerous new products around Castlevania'
partialText: What a wonderful night to have a curse!

title: Mewgenics co-creator Edmund McMillen says 'people need to get more creative with their hate' in response to disappointment over controversial cameo meows
partialText: "I understand we live in a time where a meow from someone who has different beliefs as you is scary and frustrating, confusing and controversial."

title: Nutmeg is a brilliant concept that at its best is almost football Balatro, but boy is this a game of two halves
partialText: A dream game with some nightmare trappings.

title: A fraction of the most popular PC games over the past year use hardware-level ray tracing, which is far fewer than I'd predict just 24 months ago
partialText: That's five of the 21 most popular games.

title: Nvidia's game streaming app GeForce Now touches down on Amazon Fire TV devices—yes, even the little dongles
partialText: Plug and play.

title: Fight At Midnight
partialText: Xal'atath schemes in the shadows - Azeroth prepares for battle. When the clock chimes – will you be ready to fight?

title: HyperX FlipCast gaming microphone review
partialText: Pretty good, but the price gives me serious pause.

title: Yakuza Kiwami 3 spoils an interesting remake with odd changes and an abysmally misjudged recast
partialText: I've been playing both the original and the remake simultaneously, because I have no respect for the limited time I have left on this Earth.

title: You can pick up $1000+-worth of Fallout tabletop gubbins for $25 right now, with a portion going to the ACLU
partialText: That's a lot of gubbins.

title: Den of Wolves studio 10 Chambers announces 'significant restructuring' and layoffs, 'including several of the studio’s co-founders'
partialText: 10 Chambers says the remaining team is "fully committed" to Den of Wolves.

title: Hurry, you have less than 1 week to move to Norway and have a baby with someone: 'Lie together today, get GTA 6 free from us in 9 months'
partialText: Note: Do not actually do this.

title: Behind the curtain of mouse development: from hand-carving to mechanical flinging, here's how Logitech makes and tests its gaming mice
partialText: A nice mix of mechanical accuracy with a human touch.
